properties.name: event_origin_id
properties.description: Event ID from the origin system

properties.name: thousand_eyes_event_type
properties.description: The event type received from *thousand eyes*.

properties.name: account
properties.description: The account ID for the account in Service Now

properties.name: event_message
properties.description:
The description to be put on the Service Now event.

Maximum: 4000 characters

properties.name: severity
properties.description: Local variable used to store Severity

properties.name: event_metric_name
properties.description:
Name of the metric that triggered the alert.

Maximum: 256 Characters

properties.name: event_message_short
properties.description:
A short version of the event description in Service Now

Maximum: 160 characters

Determine whether the event type should be set to "Stateless" or "Stateful". This is based on the event type parameter passed in.

If the event type is one of these:
ALERT_NOTIFICATION_TRIGGER
AGENT_ALERT_NOTIFICATION_TRIGGER

Then we set the event type to stateful. Otherwise we set to stateless

Source: https://confluence-eng-rtp1.cisco.com/conf/display/CXSSEAID/Rebecca%3A+ThousandEyes+Critical+WebSite+Health

Marked as alpha because requirements are not fully completed.

Determine whether the severity is set to "Major" or "Clear". Set to clear if event type is one of:
ALERT_NOTIFICATION_CLEAR
AGENT_ALERT_NOTIFICATION_CLEAR

Otherwise set severity to major

Source: https://confluence-eng-rtp1.cisco.com/conf/display/CXSSEAID/Rebecca%3A+ThousandEyes+Critical+WebSite+Health
Serivce now stupidly returns a 200 for failures
properties.script:
import sys,json
response = json.loads(sys.argv[1])
fail = response.get("result") and len(response['result']) and \
  isinstance(response['result'], list) and \
  response['result'][0] and 'error_message' in response['result'][0]
